isis.stitle: VT 365 Diesel Engine - 2004 Model Year - MOUNTING ENGINE ON STAND - Mounting Engine

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, make sure the engine has cooled before removing components.

To prevent personal injury or death, do not let engine fluids stay on your skin. Clean skin and nails using hand cleaner and wash with soap and water. Wash or discard clothing and rags contaminated with engine fluids.

note.para: Engine fluids (oil, fuel and coolant) are a threat to the environment. Recycle or dispose of engine fluids according to local regulations. Never put engine fluids in the trash, on the ground, in sewers or bodies of water.
Before mounting the engine on the engine stand, do steps 1 through 5.

step1.para: Remove fuel and power steering lines from the pump assembly.
Remove two coolant drain plugs and drain coolant from crankcase into a suitable container. The coolant drain plugs are in the rear of the crankcase, below the exhaust manifolds.
Remove oil pan drain plug and drain oil into a suitable container.
After fluids are drained from the engine, reinstall plugs.
Torque oil pan drain plug to the special torque .

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, attach the hoist hook lifting bracket to the engine lifting eyes before lifting the engine.

step1.para: Attach hoist hook lifting bracket to the engine lifting eyes. Use safety catches on the hoist hooks when lifting engine.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, use only grade 8 bolts to secure Engine Stand Mounting Bracket to engine and engine lift stand. Other grade bolts may shear, causing the engine to fall off engine or engine lift stand.

note.para: See manufacturer's safety instructions (included with engine lift stand and Engine Stand Mounting Bracket).

figure.caption: Mounting bolts for Engine Stand Mounting Bracket

calloutgroup.callout1: Grade 8 mounting bolts (4) to engine block
Grade 8 mounting bolts (4) to engine lift stand

step1.para: Position Engine Stand Mounting Bracket on right side of engine. Secure bracket plate with four grade 8 mounting bolts and washers.
Mount engine on engine lift stand using four grade 8 mounting bolts.
